Dua Kucing Imut Ini Sudah Keliling Jepang Lho!
05 Nov 2019, 16:25 by Putu Intan Raka Cinti


Salah satu petualangan Daikichi dan Fuku Chan dalam berkeliling Jepang. (Foto: Instagram @the.traveling.cats)

Jakarta - Traveling tak cuma jadi dominasi manusia. Tengok kisah Daikichi dan Fuku Chan, dua kucing imut yang sudah berkeliling Jepang selama 3 tahun terakhir.Daikichi (13) dan Fuku Chan (7) tak sendirian dalam aktivitas jalan-jalannya. Bersama Daisuke Nagawasa sang pemilik, mereka telah berkunjung ke 47 prefektur di Jepang.Dalam petualangannya tersebut, kedua kucing traveler ini sudah melancong ke tempat-tempat terkenal di Negeri Sakura seperti Gunung Fuji, taman bunga sakura di Kyoto dan Gerbang Torri di Hiroshima.Bagaimana ceritanya mereka bisa berpetualang bersama?Bisa dibilang aktivitas Daikichi dan Fuku Chan keliling Jepang ini tak lepas dari kegiatan Daisuke sang pemilik. Sebagai pebisnis di bidang teknologi yang sering bepergian menyambangi sejumlah tempat, ia pun kelewat sibuk jadi tak sempat mengurusi kucingnya.

[Gambas:Instagram]

Setelah dapat keluhan dari orang-orang yang ditugasinya mengasuh Daikichi dan Fuku Chan, Daisuke pun akhirnya memutuskan untuk membawa serta kucing-kucingnya itu dalam kegiatannya mengunjungi berbagai lokasi di Jepang.Daisuke kini mengaku amat menikmati waktu bepergian dengan kucing-kucingnya. Momen kebahagiaan perjalanan mereka juga dibagikan pada khalayak melalui akun Instagram @the.travelling.cats.Akun instagram ini bisa dibilang populer dengan 22,7 ribu pengikut. Sekarang Daikichi dan Fuku Chan bahkan bisa dibilang sudah menjelma jadi bintang media sosial.Tak cuma sekadar membagikan foto-foto, Daisuke juga membuat video yang mengabadikan momen perjalanan mereka dari Juni sampai Oktober tahun ini. Dalam video tersebut, terlihat mereka mengunjungi tower berusia 500 tahun di Pulau Itsukushima dan Kuil di Miyajima, Hiroshima, serta pedesaan Jepang.Dari seluruh destinasi yang mereka kunjungi, Pantai Kinenhama di Pulau Tokunoshima, Prefektur Kagoshima menjadi favorit mereka. Menurut Daisuke, tempat itu persis seperti Salar de Uyuni di Bolivia."Kucing-kucing menikmati momen ketika mereka berjalan tanpa tali penuntun padahal biasanya kami tidak pernah mengizinkan mereka seperti itu karena alasan keamanan," kata Daisuke.

[Gambas:Instagram]

Dalam video itu, ada pula momen mengharukan ketika Daikichi si kucing betina berjumpa kembali dengan kucing yang pernah menyelamatkannya. Kucing itu bernama Kaiko yang tinggal di Danau Akan, Hokkaido. Meskipun baru melihatnya lagi setelah 10 tahun, Daikichi langsung menghambur menemui Kaiko dan kemudian berbaring di sebelahnya sambil menggosokkan kepala dan perut mereka. "Dia (Kaiko) menemukan Daikichi 10 tahun yang lalu dan menyelamatkannya dari cuaca sangat dingin di Hokkaido," ujar Daisuke.Ia juga mengatakan kalau Daikichi senang bisa bertemu Kaiko, "Daikichi sangat senang melihat Kaiko lagi seperti yang Anda lihat di video. Kucing tidak pernah melupakan yang baik pada mereka."[Gambas:Instagram]Kepopuleran petualangan Daisuke, Daikichi, dan Fuku Chan ini sampai diangkat ke layar televisi dan dua program radio. Selain itu, Daisuke juga berkesempatan menerbitkan buku yang berisi kumpulan foto liburan mereka. Karenanya, Daisuke mengatakan bahwa 2019 merupakan tahun yang menyenangkan untuk mereka.Perjalanan mereka tak berhenti sampai di sini. Mereka bertiga akan lanjut jalan-jalan hingga tahun depan."Kami akan mulai melakukan perjalanan ke pulau-pulau selatan Okinawa pada awal 2020. Dan di musim panas ketika olimpiade akan dilaksanakan di Tokyo, kami juga akan merekomendasikan olahraga terbaik untuk para penonton," katanya.

These two cute cats have traveled around Japan, you know!
05 Nov 2019, 16:25 by Putu Intan Raka Cinti


One of Daikichi and Fuku Chan's adventures in traveling around Japan. (Photo: Instagram @ the.traveling.cats)

Jakarta - Traveling is not just human domination. Look at the story of Daikichi and Fuku Chan, two cute cats that have been traveling around Japan for the past 3 years. Daikichi (13) and Fuku Chan (7) are not alone in their walking activities. Together with the owner Daisuke Nagawasa, they have visited 47 prefectures in Japan. In this adventure, the two traveler cats have traveled to famous places in the Land of Sakura such as Mount Fuji, the cherry blossom garden in Kyoto and the Torri Gate in Hiroshima. they can adventure together? You could say the activities of Daikichi and Fuku Chan around Japan are not separated from the activities of the owner Daisuke. As a businessman in technology who often travels to a number of places, he is too busy so he doesn't have time to take care of his cat.

[Gambas: Instagram]

After getting complaints from the people he was assigned to take care of Daikichi and Fuku Chan, Daisuke finally decided to bring his cats along in their activities visiting various locations in Japan. Daisuke now claimed to really enjoy the time traveling with his cats. Their travel happiness moments were also shared with the public through the Instagram account @ the.travelling.cats. This Instagram account is arguably popular with 22.7 thousand followers. Now Daikichi and Fuku Chan are arguably transformed into social media stars. Not just sharing photos, Daisuke also makes videos that capture the moment of their journey from June to October this year. In the video, they were seen visiting a 500-year-old tower on Itsukushima Island and the Temple in Miyajima, Hiroshima, and rural Japan. From all the destinations they visited, Kinenhama Beach on Tokunoshima Island, Kagoshima Prefecture became their favorite. According to Daisuke, the place is exactly like Salar de Uyuni in Bolivia. "Cats enjoy the moment when they walk without guidance, whereas we usually never allow them like that for security reasons," said Daisuke.

[Gambas: Instagram]

In the video, there is also a touching moment when Daikichi the female cat meets again with the cat that once saved her. The cat named Kaiko lives in Lake Akan, Hokkaido. Even though he only saw him again after 10 years, Daikichi rushed to meet Kaiko and then lay down beside him while rubbing their heads and stomach. "He (Kaiko) found Daikichi 10 years ago and saved him from very cold weather in Hokkaido," Daisuke said. He also said that Daikichi was happy to meet Kaiko, "Daikichi was very happy to see Kaiko again like you saw in the video. Cats aren't never forget the good in them. "[Gambas: Instagram] The popularity of the adventures of Daisuke, Daikichi, and Fuku Chan has been raised to the television screen and two radio programs. In addition, Daisuke also had the opportunity to publish a book containing a collection of their vacation photos. Therefore, Daisuke said that 2019 was an exciting year for them. Their journey did not stop here. The three of them will continue their walks until next year. "We will start traveling to the southern islands of Okinawa in early 2020. And in the summer when the Olympics will be held in Tokyo, we will also recommend the best sports for the audience," he said. .
